data.title: Very good food and service
data.text: We stopped here for a quick supper.  The cheeseburger was great, my husband enjoyed the lucifer wings.  Staff was kind enough to assist with my beer choice and they were polite.

data.title: Bless this joint
data.text: If you are in Bloomington and want a real B'ton/IU experience visit Buffa Louies. The parking might be a hassle but this joint is well worth it. No other wings in town compare to what Buffa is putting out. It's at the top of Kirkwood near campus so after stuffing yourself with wings take a stroll down the famed Kirkwood Ave and visit our local shops, maybe a stoll on the old quad on campus then head back home for a nap. Just go.

data.title: Mmm, wings
data.text: Great wings, fun atomosphere. If you like sauce, you'll love Buffalouies. Baskets of wings have at least ¼ inch of sauce at the bottom for extra dipping.

data.title: Great place for wings and to watch a game!
data.text: This was my first trip to Buffalouies on Indiana St; worth the wait.  Very fun environment with lots of memorabilia to look at.  The wings were AWESOME!!!  My husband was not a fan of the way they make a chicken sandwich by ladling the sauce over the chicken AFTER it's on bun; VERY SOGGY bread :(  Otherwise we had a great time.  Our only gripe would be that the tables are not seem to be cleaned on a regular basis since there isn't a wait staff per se so we had to get some wet towels from the bathroom before resting our arms on the table as the folks before us left quite a bit of sticky sauce on the table.

data.title: If you love wings, this is a MUST!
data.text: I had heard they were the best in the state......I believe them!  There are so many choice here with amazing sides, but it really is all about the chicken.  They REALLY know wings!  Plan you visit carefully because the line can stretch far for these wings.  It's located across the street from the IU campus, so you can imagine that a good meal at a fair price would be popular with just about everyone.  There are so many sauces to choose from, but the wings are so good that you could probably just eat them without.  If you love wings, this should be your next pilgrimage!

data.title: Great wings, with a range of tasty sauces
data.text: Some time ago, service was unacceptably slow at Buffalouie's, but that has now changed.  Wings, on special every Tuesday (about $7 for 10 wings), are amazingly fast.  Good salads also, on special every Monday.  Go there for lunch; you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Average Wings & Barlike Food
data.text: I remember when a real restaurant was in this same space; it was a lovely place with a lot of history. Unfortunately it has gone through several other restaurants now but Buffalouies has stuck around for a few years. I find the food to be average but it can be one of many decent choices if you are on campus because it is right across from the Sample Gates. It can be very noisy however during the fall and spring semesters, crammed with college students.

data.title: A stop in B-Town
data.text: wonderful establishment; neat atmosphere, great sandwiches, variety of drinks and very good wings.  Went there with three others and we were all pleased when we left.

data.title: Not clean enough
data.text: I thought the open section echoed way too much with the noise of children. We were there with our son but it was really just to loud (not even game time). It was very dusty.

data.title: Decent place for wings, sandwiches, and drinks
data.text: Several visits yields mixed results.  One visit everything tasted great. A few more and food was okay. A later visit and absolutely the worst, most dry wings we have ever had.  Today one of us ordered boneless and said the boneless wings they had at a national chain two days ago were more tender and more flavorful. My traditional wings were good, but there are other places in this town that I love (not just like) the sauce. The pot roast sandwich was rated by one of us as really good. Then I wonder why $37 for 3 for lunch?  Two orders of 10 wings ($8.49 each), one sandwich ($6.99), two drinks ($1.99 each), one beer ($4.50).  Seems okay,  Parking is difficult here.  Form your own opinion.  I have never been as impressed as all of the reviews.

data.title: Fast, great wings and service
data.text: Was there during game day... Fast service, great wings and exciting energy. Friendly service. Grab a seat, drink a brew and watch a game

data.title: Lunch meeting
data.text: Wanted to find a local college hangout to have a meeting at and this place definitely hit the spot!   The wings were amazing and the burgers are to die for!

data.title: Excellent wings...
data.text: A staple of the Bloomington restaurant scene, Buffalouies is a must visit in the area. Decorated in everything IU / college dormish. Food is good and the environment is better.

data.title: Cool place in Bloomington
data.text: My daughter and I stopped in here on her last day as a freshman at IU.  It looks like a sports bar with wood everywhere, flatscreen TVs and beer on the menu.  But it feels like a family place too.  A wide range of options on the menu and friendly service is what you'll find.  We both got different versions of boneless chicken and the sauces were very good.  A good spot for a quick lunch or dinner.

data.title: Wings done tasty good
data.text: We had a long weekend and my lovely declared - honey wings fir dinner tonight ! I replied Buffa - she said - Louie's ! Off we went with a side kick along for dinner - my mild wings were hot and crispy - fries yummy with cheese and my wife loves the side salad crunchy you good - I finish for her! My friend had a sandwich and not a crumb was left.

data.title: Fun restaurant, great food!
data.text: We came to Bloomington recently to visit our son who is a student at IU.  He immediately requested Buffalouies for lunch.  He loves wings and burgers so this was a perfect place to go! You order up front and then find a seat.  We timed it just right and didn't have to wait but around 1:30 on a Sunday the line was to the door! The burgers were crazy good!  There are many kinds to choose from and all three of us loved our burgers!  The wings were some of the best we've had.  You can get a mix if you want which is what we did. They were so good I am already thinking of making another trip to Bloomington soon!  The place is loud, fun and caters to the college kids but that is ok.  We enjoyed sitting at the bar area facing the outside and watching people go by.  Football was on and the place was rowdy but that just adds to the experience of eating there. It's not cheap- but is well worth it. We had 20 boneless wings and 3 burgers and drinks and it was close to $50. Money well spent for lunch with our son, a great meal in a fun college town.

data.title: Great joint!
data.text: I was here visiting Indiana University with my daughter who is coming here in the fall, and on our last night we wanted some quick light food! We were told Buffalouies is the place to go- great wings and sandwiches. It's right outside the sample gates of IU, and the decor inside is all IU sports memorabilia. It's a big place, filled with college kids, families, alumni, and anyone with a taste for good wings. We had the mild buffalo wings (delicious! spicy enough to be good, but not so spicy that we were in pain) and the honey garlic ones (delicious! just sweet enough). The wings are crispy and covered in a nice thin sauce. We didn't have the chicken sandwiches, but heard only great things about them. This is definitely the place to go if you want a local hang out and great wings!
